text: Robert Smail Whitelaw "Bob" Wilson (born 29 June 1934) is a Scottish former professional footballer. He was a half-back. He began his professional career with Aberdeen, before going on to play for a number of English clubs. He was captain of the original incarnation of Accrington Stanley when the club resigned from The Football League in 1962.Rec.Sport.Soccer Statistics Foundation ==References== Category:1934 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from East Lothian
title: Bob Wilson (footballer, born 1934)
